title: ICE when calling method on generic impl constrained by unmet trait alias

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Similar to #108072, but when the method cannot be found. ### Code ```Rust #![feature(trait_alias)] trait IteratorAlias = Iterator; struct Foo(I); impl Foo { fn f() {} } fn main() { Foo::<()>::f() } ``` [Playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=54894f62f64480d62e1f8a5917687199) ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.69.0-nightly (2d14db321 2023-02-15) binary: rustc commit-hash: 2d14db321b043ffc579a7461464c88d7e3f54f83 commit-date: 2023-02-15 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.69.0-nightly LLVM version: 15.0.7 ``` ### Error output ``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'internal error: entered unreachable code: encountered `Item(Item { ident: IteratorAlias#0, owner_id: DefId(0:3 ~ playground[d092]::IteratorAlias), kind: TraitAlias(Generics { params: [], predicates: [], has_where_clause_predicates: false, where_clause_span: src/main.rs:3:31: 3:31 (#0), span: src/main.rs:3:20: 3:20 (#0) }, [Trait(PolyTraitRef { bound_generic_params: [], trait_ref: TraitRef { path: Path { span: src/main.rs:3:23: 3:31 (#0), res: Def(Trait, DefId(2:7197 ~ core[f0a8]::iter::traits::iterator::Iterator)), segments: [PathSegment { ident: Iterator#0, hir_id: HirId(DefId(0:3 ~ playground[d092]::IteratorAlias).1), res: Def(Trait, DefId(2:7197 ~ core[f0a8]::iter::traits::iterator::Iterator)), args: None, infer_args: false }] }, hir_ref_id: HirId(DefId(0:3 ~ playground[d092]::IteratorAlias).2) }, span: src/main.rs:3:23: 3:31 (#0) }, None)]), span: src/main.rs:3:1: 3:32 (#0), vis_span: src/main.rs:3:1: 3:1 (#0) })`', compiler/rustc_hir_typeck/src/method/suggest.rs:729:35 ```
Backtrace
